dt: {bc}a {d_link|plausible|plausible} or scientifically acceptable general principle or body of principles offered to explain phenomena
{bc}a belief, policy, or procedure proposed or followed as the basis of action

dt.t: her method is based on the {wi}theory{/wi} that all children want to learn

dt: {bc}an ideal or hypothetical set of facts, principles, or circumstances
often used in the phrase {it}in theory{/it}

dt.t: in {wi}theory{/wi}, we have always advocated freedom for all

dt: {bc}a hypothesis assumed for the sake of argument or investigation
{bc}a body of {d_link|theorems|theorem} presenting a concise systematic view of a subject
{bc}the general or abstract {d_link|principles|principle} of a body of fact, a science, or an art
{bc}the analysis of a set of facts in their relation to one another

pt: {sc}hypothesis{/sc} {sc}theory{/sc} {sc}law{/sc} mean a formula derived by inference from scientific data that explains a principle operating in nature. {sc}hypothesis{/sc} implies insufficient evidence to provide more than a tentative explanation.

pt.t: a {it}hypothesis{/it} explaining the extinction of the dinosaurs

pt: {sc}theory{/sc} implies a greater range of evidence and greater likelihood of truth.
{sc}law{/sc} implies a statement of order and relation in nature that has been found to be invariable under the same conditions.

quotes.t: While strolling around, we kept the run of the moon all the time, and we still kept an eye on her after we got back to the hotel portico. I had a {qword}theory{/qword} that the gravitation of refraction, being subsidiary to atmospheric compensation, the refrangibility of the earth's surface would emphasize this effect in regions where great mountain ranges occur, and possibly so even-handed impact the odic and idyllic forces together, the one upon the other, as to prevent the moon from rising higher than 12,200 feet above sea-level. This daring {qword}theory{/qword} had been received with frantic scorn by some of my fellow-scientists, and with an eager silence by others.
The {qword}theory{/qword} of the teacher with all these immigrant kids was that if you spoke English loudly enough they would eventually understand.
The family's {qword}theory{/qword} was that the cheating businessmen somehow framed their brother.
The immune surveillance {qword}theory{/qword} of cancer holds that in a way we all do have cancer, that a healthy immune system fights off rogue cells as they appear.

shortdef: a plausible or scientifically acceptable general principle or body of principles offered to explain phenomena
a belief, policy, or procedure proposed or followed as the basis of action
an ideal or hypothetical set of facts, principles, or circumstances —often used in the phrase in theory

dt: {bc}a theory of the nature of matter: all material substances are composed of minute particles or atoms of a comparatively small number of kinds and all the atoms of the same kind are uniform in size, weight, and other properties
{bc}any of several theories of the structure of the atom

{bc}one based on experimentation and theoretical considerations holding that the atom is composed essentially of a small positively charged comparatively heavy nucleus surrounded by a comparatively large arrangement of electrons

shortdef: a theory of the nature of matter: all material substances are composed of minute particles or atoms of a comparatively small number of kinds and all the atoms of the same kind are uniform in size, weight, and other properties

any of several theories of the structure of the atom; especially : one based on experimentation and theoretical considerations holding that the atom is composed essentially of a small positively charged comparatively heavy nucleus surrounded by a comparatively large arrangement of electrons

dt: {bc}a view of filmmaking in which the director is considered the primary creative force in a motion picture

shortdef: a view of filmmaking in which the director is considered the primary creative force in a motion picture

dt: {bc}a theory in astronomy: the universe originated billions of years ago in a rapid expansion from a single point of nearly infinite energy density {dx}compare {dxt|steady state theory||}{/dx}

shortdef: a theory in astronomy: the universe originated billions of years ago in a rapid expansion from a single point of nearly infinite energy density

dt: {bc}a theory in early quantum physics: an atom consists of a positively charged nucleus about which revolves one or more electrons of quantized energy

shortdef: a theory in early quantum physics: an atom consists of a positively charged nucleus about which revolves one or more electrons of quantized energy

dt: {bc}mathematical theory and conjecture that uses topology to explain events (such as an earthquake or a stock market crash) characterized by major abrupt changes

shortdef: mathematical theory and conjecture that uses topology to explain events (such as an earthquake or a stock market crash) characterized by major abrupt changes

dt: {bc}a theory in biology that includes one or both of the statements that the cell is the fundamental structural and functional unit of living matter and that the organism is composed of autonomous cells with its properties being the sum of those of its cells

shortdef: a theory in biology that includes one or both of the statements that the cell is the fundamental structural and functional unit of living matter and that the organism is composed of autonomous cells with its properties being the sum of those of its cells

dt: {bc}a branch of mathematical and physical theory that deals with the nature and consequences of chaos and chaotic systems

shortdef: a branch of mathematical and physical theory that deals with the nature and consequences of chaos and chaotic systems
